column4: umm... T.T  one of my laptops just started failing to boot.  The boot hangs at PulseAudio configured for per-user sessions   saned disabled; edit /etc/default/saned     [OK]
I had killed a process on the previous boot that I thought was the xsession...  I feel like I just did something stupid...
Oh, actually I can get to the ttys and login, not sure why I don't get to lightdm on tty7 though

I'm not sure what I should be looking for in there, and I'm not sure how to pastebin it from the terminal.  The gist of the last two lines is:  (II) Unloading evdev    and    ddxSigGiveUp: Closing Log
so I suppose, from that lines, is that X is not starting
hmm, it fails, doesn't give anything on the command line, but doing ps ax | grep light doesn't return anything, and while it switched over to tty7, nothing changed on that tty
nothing at all? were you installing a new graphics driver?

nothing at all.  Nope, didn't install anything recently.  I've found an error in the logs though Error compiling keymap   Failed to load keymap.  Loading default keymap instead.   generating xkmfile /tmp/...   Error compiling keymap    couldn't compile keymap  Failed to compile keymap   Keyboard initialization filed.  This could be a missing or incorrect setup of xkeyboard-config.   Fatal server error:   Failed to activate core devic
if it's installed, run sudo apt-get install --reinstall x11-xkb-utils
there are also errors in .xsessionerrors regarding the same.  I'll try that now, just need a bit to get an internet connection
You're a total boss man!  Do you think killing that process was the cause though?  The process I killed was /usr/bin/dbus-launch --exit-with-session /usr/bin/gnome-session --session=ubuntu-2d
could be, yeah. no idea though, I just googled one of the error messages
ah, thanks, I should have done that, lol, sorry about that, I really appreciate the help ^_^
btw I googled this:  "Error compiling keymap"
hmm, yeah, interesting, I'll have to look into what happened to those files.
